intro: Pouchetia africana, commonly known as the African pouchetia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has woody stems and is often found in shrubland or forest understory habitats. The leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
